user_rights.title: 18. Your Rights under nDSG
user_rights.description: According to the Federal Act on Data Protection (nDSG), you have the following rights:
rights: Right of Access (Art. 25 nDSG): You have the right to free information about your stored personal data, their origin and recipients, and the purpose of data processing.
Right to Rectification (Art. 32 Para. 1 nDSG): You can request the correction of inaccurate data.
Right to Erasure (Art. 32 Para. 2 lit. a nDSG): You have the right to request the deletion of your data, provided there are no legal retention obligations.
Right to Data Portability (Art. 28 nDSG): You can receive your data in a structured, commonly used, and machine-readable format and have it transmitted to another controller.
Right to Object: You have the right to object to the processing of your data at any time for reasons arising from your particular situation.
Right to Lodge a Complaint (Art. 49 nDSG): You have the right to lodge a complaint with the competent supervisory authority.
